page.title: 03Shobrooke Village
page.content: We went to Shobrooke Village. The church there is called St Swithin's church and the Holy Well is locked nearby. The private school there was once behind the church then it moved to School Close and then it was put on the corner of the triangle. Shobrooke Park was once called Fulford Park by the owners but a man died and the funeral directors went to the wrong Fulford Park (as there was another Fulford Park near Tedburn St Mary) so they changed this Fulford Park to the name Shobrooke Park. Shobrooke is sometimes called Little Silver because of the river and sometimes Shobrooke because of the bridge over the brook. Shobrooke has about 50 houses, 1 post office, 1 pub and a garage with services plus old peoples home and a private school.
